channel.title: My DH Blog
channel.description: Recent content on My DH Blog

item.title: Hello friend! or the very first post
item.description: my very first post - nothing very specific

item.title: My DH Favorites
item.description: Photo by Joshua Goldeon UnsplashHetre I would like to refer to my favorite DH web projects. I love history, so they probably will be about history related themes. And at the moment they are more about Latvian initiatives. So for the starter : Latvian Hillforts My absolute favorite is one from Latvian citizen science. It is a map - guide - repository of publicly available data on Iron to Bronze age hillfort locations in Latvia.

item.title: Maps
item.description: ###Maps are for me! I hope this time the site will work and I can show some real projects. I like maps since early age and now both digital and paper maps. Historic, topographic, orthophoto and others. My favorite map source for Latvia history is (https://vesture.dodies.lv/) and second (https://www.lvmgeo.lv/kartes)

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome! My name is Evita Rudovča, I love coffee, maps and hiking hillforts. These are my last weeks in the program Digital Humanities and I am enjoying it while it lasts. It is funny that in last semester of studies in Digital Humanities we finally have a course Intro to Digital Humanities. Its interesting and full of valuable information. Mostly for those who are used to process lot of text material, but not only that.

item.title: HEINRICI CHROINICOIN LYVONIAE.txt
item.description: HEINRICI CHROINICOIN LYVONIAE. LIBER PRIMUS. . Divina providencia, memor Raab1 et Babilonis2 ^^, (I.) videlicet confuse gentilitatis, nostris et modernis temporibus Lyvones3 ydolatras ab ydolatrie et peccatr sompno taliter igne sui amoris excitavit. Fuit vir vite venerabilis et venerande canicieip-) Meynardus4, sacerdos ex ordine beati Augustini, in cenobio Sigebergens5i^^ Hic simpliciter pro Christo et predicandi tantum causa cum comitatu mercato- rum Lyvonia6m venit^®. Theutonici enim mercatores, Lyvonibus famiiiaritate coniuncti, Lyvoniam7 fre- quenter navigio pier Dune8 flumen adire solebant.
